meanings.definition: Coat or smear (a surface) with a thick or sticky substance.
meanings.sent1: She daubed paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The artist daubed colors onto the palette.
meanings.sent3: The child daubed frosting on the cake with her fingers.
meanings.sent4: The sky was daubed with hues of pink and orange at sunset.
meanings.sent5: He daubed the walls with mud, creating a rustic look.

meanings.definition: Apply (a substance) with a coarse or unskillful hand.
meanings.sent1: He daubed glue on the paper messily.
meanings.sent2: She daubed sunscreen on her skin before going to the beach.
meanings.sent3: The chef daubed sauce on the dish in a haphazard manner.
meanings.sent4: The gardener daubed fertilizer on the plants carelessly.
meanings.sent5: The child daubed paint on the walls, leaving streaks everywhere.

meanings.definition: Cover (a surface) with a thick or sticky substance.
meanings.sent1: The workers daubed the wall with cement.
meanings.sent2: She daubed the bread with butter.
meanings.sent3: The prankster daubed the doorknob with honey as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The artist daubed the canvas with wax for texture.
meanings.sent5: The chef daubed the steak with a rich sauce before grilling.
